definitions: To tolerate or endure something unpleasant.
To place something somewhere, often quickly or carelessly.
To accept or put up with a difficult situation or person.
To direct something forcefully or aggressively towards someone or something.
To abandon or give up on something, often in frustration.
examples: You just have to stick it out until the project is finished.
He decided to stick it to the man and quit his job.
She told him to stick it where the sun don't shine.
They had to stick it to the wall with tape.
I can't stick it anymore; I'm leaving.
